docs.snippet: Correspondence of the Cincinnati Gazette.  I have seen a gentleman directly from Nashville, who, though unable to give me with certainty the enemy's number at Bowling Green, says it is reported at Nashville variously from 10,000 to 30,000. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: Correspondence of the Cincinnati Gazette. I have seen a gentleman directly from Nashville, who, though unable to give me with certainty the enemy's number at Bowling Green, says it is reported at Nashville variously from 10,000 to 30,000. The portion of the troops seen by him were finelooking, athletic men, well equipped and well disciplined.

docs.snippet: It is frequently spoken of as something to surprise one that a physician and surgeon, in the midst of the most active professional employment, should find time to be a prolitic and profitable writer on the various topics that fill this journal. But...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is frequently spoken of as something to surprise one that a physician and surgeon, in the midst of the most active professional employment, should find time to be a prolitic and profitable writer on the various topics that fill this journal. But there should be no surprise about it.

docs.snippet: Since the 2d day of September, our Battery (New-York Ninth S.M.) has been divided and subdivided, and the second section, to which I belong, has been continually on the move up and down the banks of the Potomac, and we have taken part in every...

headline.main: THE NINTH REGIMENT OF NEW-YORK MILITIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since the 2d day of September, our Battery (New-York Ninth S.M.) has been divided and subdivided, and the second section, to which I belong, has been continually on the move up and down the banks of the Potomac, and we have taken part in every skirmish during the past month.

docs.snippet: France is the most military nation in the world, both by instinct and training. The development of the military power of the Empire engrosses the vast energies of the present, as it did those of the first NAPOLEON. Yet to put one in a hundred of his...

headline.main: The Contending Forces Their Relative Strength.

docs.lead_paragraph: France is the most military nation in the world, both by instinct and training. The development of the military power of the Empire engrosses the vast energies of the present, as it did those of the first NAPOLEON. Yet to put one in a hundred of his subjects into the field, or 375,000 men, thoroughly equipped for active operation, would tax his means, far exceeding those of any other ruler, to the utmost.

headline.main: SUPPLIES FOR THE ARMY.; APPEAL FROM THE SANITARY COMMISSION. NAMES OF THE FORTIFICATIONS NEAR WASHINGTON. ARMS FOR THE REBELS LOADING AT HAVANA. A PRIZE. A PRIZE PURCHASED BY GOVERNMENT. MORE PRISONERS RELEASED. MORE PRIVATEERS. THE PIRATE SUMTER. KENTUCKY. RECRUITING IN CANADA. INDIANA. THE POLITICAL CAMPAIGN IN MASSACHUSETTS. A UNION MEETING IN PHILADELPHIA. POSITION OF HON. REVERDY JOHNSON. WASHINGTON, Monday, Sept. 23, 1861. FORTIFYING BALTIMORE.

docs.lead_paragraph: Your aid is asked in accomplishing the object of the appeal below. It is known that the rebel army is largely supplied with clothing, arms, saddles, and even food and ammunition, by forced and voluntary contributions from the deluded people of the South.

headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; The Rebels Near Washington Still Quiet. The Main Body Believed to be at Manassas. Return of Gen. Wool to Fortress Monroe. Doubts About His Going to St. Louis. Mysterious Movements of the Rebels in Missouri. THE LOSS OF THE PROPELLER FANNY. ARRIVAL OF THE HARRIET LANE. SUBSCRIBERS TO THE POPULAR LOAN. WARM WEATHER. TEAMSTERS AND HORSES. GEN.
